c74object.name: fluid.list2buf
c74object.digest: Copy a list to a buffer~
c74object.description: Copies the values of a list to a buffer~.
c74object.discussion:
Open the Overview Patch fluid.list2buf copies the values of a list to a buffer~.
This is a convenient way of transforming data such that it can interface with other FluCoMa objects that expect to receive a buffer.
Be aware that if a buffer of a predefined size is not supplied as the output it will defer the copying. If you need the copying to occur in the high priority thread, supply a buffer with the size of the input.
fluid.list2buf is part of the Fluid Decomposition Toolkit of the FluCoMa project. For more explanations, learning material, and discussions on its musicianly uses, visit flucoma.org.

objarg.name: maxsize
objarg.description: Sets a maximum size for the internal list. The absolute maximum in Max is 32767.

method.name: list
method.description: Copy the values from the incoming list to the destination buffer~. If the buffer~ is not big enough, autosize is enabled and procesing is triggered from the main thread, then the buffer~ will be resized. If called from the scheduler thread, no resize will be attempted and a warning will be printed to the console.

attribute.name: autosize
attribute.digest: Determines if the output buffer will be resized according to the size of the input list.
attribute.description: Sets whether the destination buffer~ should be resized as needed. Note that this only applies when invoking from the main thread: buffer~s can not be resized from the high priority thread.

attribute.name: axis
attribute.digest: Direction in which to write to destination.
attribute.description: In what direction to write data to destination. 0 writes frame by frame, 1 writes channel-by-channel.

attribute.name: destination
attribute.digest: The buffer~ to copy the list values to.
attribute.description: Sets the destination buffer~ into which to write list data. If this is unset then the object will use its own automatically named buffer~.

attribute.name: startchan
attribute.description: For multichannel output buffers, which channel to begin copying to. The default is 0.

attribute.name: startframe
attribute.description: The starting index (in samples) to copy list to the destination buffer~.
